Package fr.rphstudio.codingdojo.game.functions

Interface Display

public interface Display
DISPLAY FUNCTIONS
This module gathers all functions that are used to modify the appearance of the ship. You can modify the shape of the ship, the name displayed above, and the color. All these information you can modify are readable too.
Author:
Romuald GRIGNON

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getPlayerColorBlue()
    Gets the blue component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
    int getPlayerColorGreen()
    Gets the green component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
    int getPlayerColorRed()
    Gets the red component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
    int getPlayerColorTransparency()
    Gets the alpha component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
    java.lang.String getPlayerName()
    Gets the name of the current ship (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerName(String) previously.
    int getShipShape()
    Gets the shape number for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    It will return the value given in parameter to selectShip(int) previously.
    void selectShip​(int shapeNumber)
    Selects the shape for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    void setPlayerColor​(int r, int g, int b, int a)
    Sets the color for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    It is also possible to change the transparency.
    void setPlayerName​(java.lang.String newName)
    Sets the new name for the current ship (Code Level #--).

  • Method Details

    • setPlayerName

      void setPlayerName​(java.lang.String newName)
      Sets the new name for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      Parameters:
      newName - the string to be used as the new name.

    • setPlayerColor

      void setPlayerColor​(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Sets the color for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      It is also possible to change the transparency.
      Parameters:
      r - an integer value for the red component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full red).
      g - an integer value for the green component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full green).
      b - an integer value for the blue component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full blue).
      a - an integer value for the transparency between 0 (invisible) and 255 (no transparency).

    • selectShip

      void selectShip​(int shapeNumber)
      Selects the shape for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      Parameters:
      shapeNumber - an integer value to select the shape, between 1 and 36. Be careful, if the parameter is below '1', the value will be processed as '1'. If the parameter is more than 36, the value will be processed as 36.

      Here below is the picture of all shapes with their related numbers. This would help you to make your choice :

    • getPlayerName

      java.lang.String getPlayerName()
      Gets the name of the current ship (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerName(String) previously.
      Returns:
      the string used for the ship name.

    • getPlayerColorRed

      int getPlayerColorRed()
      Gets the red component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
      Returns:
      an integer value for the red component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full red).

    • getPlayerColorGreen

      int getPlayerColorGreen()
      Gets the green component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
      Returns:
      an integer value for the green component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full green).

    • getPlayerColorBlue

      int getPlayerColorBlue()
      Gets the blue component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
      Returns:
      an integer value for the blue component between 0 (dark) and 255 (full blue).

    • getPlayerColorTransparency

      int getPlayerColorTransparency()
      Gets the alpha component of the current ship color (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to setPlayerColor(int, int, int, int) previously.
      Returns:
      an integer value for the alpha component between 0 (invisible) and 255 (no transparency).

    • getShipShape

      int getShipShape()
      Gets the shape number for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      It will return the value given in parameter to selectShip(int) previously.
      Returns:
      an integer number for the selected shape.
